bibl.title: Ostraca and Architecture at Kom el-Dikka.
bibl.note: O. Alex. Inv. W2S/3521-3522 (= S.B. XVI, 12819-12820) and W1/2204 [ed.: Adam ŁUKASZEWICZ, An Ostracon from Alexandria, 50 Years of Polish Excavations in Egypt and the Near East. Acts of the Symposium at the Warsaw University 1986 (Varsovie, 1992) pp. 215-216] contribute to the interpretation of the architectural structures excavated at Kom el-Dikka by the Polish Centre of Mediterranean Archaeology (University of Warsaw). "Wine cellar should be considered the most probable explanation of the vaulted structure."
ŁUKASZEWICZ Adam, Ostraca and Architecture at Kom el-Dikka.
